lead_paragraph: The Washington captain Chris Clark scored his first two goals last night, and the Capitals’ juggled lineup produced the team’s highest output of the season in a 5-3 win over the visiting Tampa Bay Lightning. Alex Ovechkin had two assists and an empty-net goal with four seconds left to help the Capitals end a four-game losing streak.In other games, Eric Staal, Jeff Hamilton, Cory Stillman and Bret Hedican scored third-period goals as the Carolina Hurricanes defeated visiting Buffalo, 6-2, for their first victory over the Sabres since Game 7 of the 2006 Eastern Conference finals.Olli Jokinen scored twice to become Florida’s career leader in goals and points as the host Panthers edged the Philadelphia Flyers, 4-3. Jokinen’s first goal was his 355th point with the Panthers and his second goal was his 158th.Tomas Holmstrom scored his sixth and seven goals, and Matt Ellis also had a goal, as the Red Wings defeated the Vancouver Canucks, 3-2, in Detroit.
